content.question: Which of the following best explains why European governments began to pass laws regulating labor conditions over the course of the nineteenth century?

choices.label: Governments wanted to return to the guild system of labor.
Governments were increasingly under political pressure to relieve problems caused by industrialization.
Governments were increasingly influenced by laissez-faire economic policies.
Governments wanted to redirect industrial laborers toward conscripted military service.

content.answer: Governments were increasingly under political pressure to relieve problems caused by industrialization.

topic.text: 6.1: Contextualizing Industrialization and its Origins and Effects
